Head of Data Science
National Retailer
· Work amongst inspirational, friendly, exceptional talent!
· A genuine agile, innovative, highly producitonised data science environment
· Managing and continue to grow a team which has scaled rapidly in recent years
· Deliver real commercial impact for this retail goliath, through a wide variety of data science projects
Salary: Dependent on experience & up to 40% stretch target bonus
Location: London / flexible wfh
Like a lot of companies, our client has developed an internal data science team, but unusually, one to rival the top tech firms in terms of quality of talent, delivery of direct commercial return and opportunity to innovate.
You will lead and continue to grow a team of Data Scientists delivering a wide range of projects leveraging machine learning and AI techniques to optimize and automate processes and inform decision making around trading, pricing and promotions, fulfilment and supply resourcing.
As the business continues to embrace data science from the top down, you will need to use your skills in guiding, educating and inspiring very senior level stakeholders, as they truly embedd use of data science to drive, inform and change internal processes and the way the business is run.
Importantly, we need a very strong leader of people, someone who understands how to retain top tier talent with challenge and opportunity, support, coaching and career growth. You will need to inspire and lead from the front on project initiation, system design, process definition ensuring all the right Q’s are being asked and answered. Leading the conversation on architecture throughout a project, ensuring they’re built in a productionised way, ensuring the robustness is in place, given the reach the solutions have, across millions of products week in week out.
Their way of working is very practical, from end to end, dealing with customer focused problems, and naturally, you should be comfortable, and ideally have experience with, the typical culture and pace of retail.
Everyone within this centralized data science function can code – so you will need to be able to, too - there is a constant environment of learning, growth and development at every level and truly innovation products and solutions can be delivered. So we are looking for someone who is still ‘hands on’ in order to coach and mentor the rapidly growing team, guiding on best practice etc.
Skills and experience required:
Educated to at least degree level in a numerate subject such as engineering, mathematics, statistics, chemistry, physics, machine learning, computer science etc.
Advanced hands on skills using tools such as Python, R, Spark, Hadoop, SQL and cloud based platforms such as GCP, Azure and AWS to manipulate and analyse various data sets in large volumes
Background in data science from ideally a retail or blue chip background
Confident and strong presentation skills; ability to bring data to life for senior leaders and non-technical stakeholders
Thrives in a pacey, entrepreneurial and high performing environment
Strong team collaboration skills, able to work in a dynamic and solutions focused environment

The Team
Our highly specialised Data Science and AI team in our KPMG ‘Lighthouse’ uses advanced analytical techniques and industrial scale technology platforms to help our clients accelerate their digital transformation journeys. Typical projects require extracting a variety of data at large scale, drawing deep insights using complex analytical algorithms, and visualising the results to articulate compelling and engaging stories that, in the end, deliver increased value from that data. Our UK team works closely together with data science and engineering teams around the world, on building intelligent systems and products, to maximise our collective success.

Our Data Scientists support the whole firm on a wide variety of projects, across our Audit, Tax and Advisory business. We are experienced in managing diverse issues including business disruption, process optimisation, fraud, regulatory compliance, dispute resolution, deriving value from contracts and much more. Our Data Scientists support client work on a variety of projects across many industries including but not limited to: Financial Service, Retail, Public Sector, Healthcare, Energy and Utilities.

Roles and Responsibilities
Client Project Delivery: A Senior Manager/Lead Data Scientist would typically manage teams of Data Scientists on multiple engagements, focused on developing new, or tailoring existing, AI solutions designed for processing large data sets (e.g., using a Hadoop framework) that accelerate our clients’ digital journeys. This could include creating Proof of Concept, delivering minimal viable products or fully fledged projects including putting our models into production either on our own or our client’s environments.
Business Development: Work collaboratively with our business teams and our clients to show the art of the possible and to assess possible value and feasibility of applying data science to help solve specific business problems. Convert new business opportunities into revenue. This could include demoing to prospective clients, developing data strategies, leading feasibility studies, and supporting RFP responses.
Asset Development: Build data science assets (aka ‘accelerators’), in line with our UK and/or global strategy, to ensure we have the platforms and core assets in place to meet market demand. This could also include supporting our continuous improvement process around our own design and development processes e.g. about how we ensure the high quality that our clients require in an efficient manner
Collaboration: Liaise with our advanced data engineering and cloud engineering team for architecture design and model deployment to jointly build solutions and products that will interoperate seamlessly with other elements of the broader information architecture. Liaise with global ‘Lighthouse’ and other KPMG member firms for knowledge sharing and collaboration opportunities.
People: As a fast growing highly specialised team, you will be involved in the running and growing of our team, e.g., through involvement in hiring and coaching colleagues, helping with knowledge management, resource planning, process refinement, and other practice management activities.

Skills and Qualifications
Well versed at applying advanced analytical and AI techniques to large and varied data sets, generated and flowing at a rapid rate. Sample techniques include, but are not limited to:
Applied machine learning
Natural language processing
Computer Vision
Anomaly detection
Bayesian Statistics
Timeseries forecasting
Analytical and Computational Optimisation
Collaborative filtering and recommender systems
Graph Analytics
Experience with:
Generating and test working hypotheses, prepare and analyse historical data, identify patterns from samples for reporting of trends and support Predictive Analytics
Leveraging data visualisation techniques and tools to effectively demonstrate patterns, outliers, and exceptional conditions in the data
Creating performance metrics and tracking processes to measure the effectiveness of Data Science solutions
Conceptualising necessary data governance models to support the technical solution and assure the veracity of the data
Operating within the exploratory and experimental aspects of Data Science, e.g., to tease out interesting and previously unknown insights from vast pools of data
Working collaboratively with other members of the Data Science and Information Architecture teams to innovate and create compelling data-centric stories and experiences
Proficient with programming languages used by data scientists and in Big Data platforms, like Python, R, Scala
Software engineering paradigms like scripting and Object-Oriented Programming
At least one major cloud provider (AWS, GCP, Azure), their machine learning and engineering services.
Cloud service architecture and design
End-to-end product life cycle management
Deploying models into production, with awareness of the challenges.
MLOps – MLFlow, Kubeflow, BentoML or similar preferred
Track record in staying conversant in new analytic technologies, architectures, and languages – where necessary – for storing, processing, and manipulating this type of data
Demonstrated Data Science leadership skills, e.g. around establishing or growing Data Science teams through recruiting talented individuals, training colleagues, writing proposals and designing and delivering high value proposition
Persuasive power to communicate with a variety of stakeholders in the organisation
Working with Market Segment Leaders and their account teams, to identify strategic client issues, shape deals which demonstrate business value and work hands-on to lead engagements which leverage AI to solve business problems
Assist in the full sales cycle, taking a leadership role in the creation of new highly differentiated solutions
Planning and organisation skills so as to work with a high-performance team, handle demanding clients and multitask effectively
Extensive experience in AI, data science, data engineering and/or other technology related capabilities in one or multiple industries.
BSc (ideally MSc or PhD) or equivalent in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or similar technical field
A combination of one or more of the following:
Proficient with programming languages used by data scientists like Python, R, Scala,
Proficient with Git, Linux, Docker
Software Engineering best practices and Object-Oriented Programming
Skills in data engineering technologies like Hadoop, HDFS, Spark, Elasticsearch
SQL and NoSQL databases

GCP – Machine Learning Engineering
GCP – Data Engineering
Azure – Data Scientist

Most importantly, Layer sits on top of your existing data and tech stack and works in your dev environment for you with zero friction.

Layer has an all remote culture as we aspire to work with the best talent, no matter where they live. We firmly believe that exceptional companies can only be built by exceptional people. We look for people who are passionate about their work, grounded, achieve more with less, are full of grit, challenge themselves and their team relentlessly to do better, and have radical candour. Raise awareness through writing tutorials, articles and leading conversation both in-person and via online platforms.
Reach out and advise ML practitioners who want to open their projects on Layer.
Channel community feedback to the Product and Engineering departments based on your findings.
Be analytical and data-driven in creating useful content for the community. Define, report and analyze metrics to understand our community’s needs and interests.
Be a connector and maintain an engaged presence online. Respond to timely discussions and questions on social media and design shareable, creative campaigns for regular tweets and posts.
Drive trial and demand for our products through demonstration advocacy.

Experience in either data science or open-source software.
Experience blogging or publishing technical content online. Bonus points if it’s related to open source or data science.
Experience building and/or managing a technical community.
Understanding of Git, Git-flow and CI/CD. You don’t have to be a superuser, but we make tools built around Git and you’ll need to know how to use them.
Strong communication skills - the ability to explain and translate complex concepts into simple communication.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

Nice to have's:

Knowledge of our tools and the MLOps space.
A strong network within data science or open source communities.
Experience developing ML algorithms or models.
Working in a high growth start or scale-up.

Amazon’s mission is to be the most customer centric company in the world. The Workforce Staffing organization is on the front line of that mission by hiring the hourly fulfilment associates who make that mission a reality. To drive the necessary growth and continued scale of Amazon’s associate needs within a constrained employment environment, Amazon is creating a Workforce Staffing research program.

This program will re-invent how Amazon attracts, communicates with, and ultimately hires its hourly associates. This team will own multi-layered research and program implementation to drive deep learnings, process improvements, and strategic recommendations to global leadership. Are you passionate about data? Are you a tinkerer by trade? Do you enjoy questioning the status quo? Do complex and difficult challenges excite you? If yes, this may be the team for you.

As a Manager, Data Science in Workforce Staffing, you will have a strong focus on quantitative data analysis, understanding labor markets and the candidates within them. You will be responsible for building and developing a team, developing roadmaps, and driving business impact through your research at global scale.

You will lead data science projects using your deep expertise in statistics (regressions, multilevel models, structural equation models, etc.), and data collection in a variety of settings (e.g., field studies, surveys, existing large data sets) to define and answer nebulous problems. You leverage your quantitative background to develop and test theoretical frameworks and design experiments. You design, deployment, and conduct analysis of our global candidate research activities, using experimental, quasi-experimental, and RCT methods. You relentlessly obsess over understanding our candidates and what attracts them to Amazon. You work with colleagues across Research, Data Science, Business Intelligence and related teams to enable Amazon find and hire the right candidates for the right roles at an unprecedented scale.

A customer-obsessed, relentless curiosity is a must, as is commitment to the highest standards of methodological rigor that a given study allows. This role provides opportunity for significant exposure to Amazon’s culture, leadership, and global businesses, and furthermore provides significant opportunity to influence how Workforce Staffing matches talent to business demand.

This will be a highly visible role across multiple key deliverables for our global organization. If you are passionate and curious about data, obsess over customers, love questioning the status quo, and want to make the world a better place, let’s chat. #scienceemea

Prior experience and knowledge of product management is essential particularly in a digital/systems capacity
Experience taking products from idea generation through to product launch and ongoing maintenance
Highly numerate with strong and proven analytical skills to be able to commercially assess the value of opportunities within the pipeline
Experience of delivering data science proof of concepts and productionised models is advantageous
Sound understanding of data science and machine learning principles

Ultimately, we're looking for passionate people who will thrive on the challenge of demonstrating the value we can add as a Machine Learning team.
